docs.snippet: Argentina will take its dispute over plans by British oil companies to explore for oil off the coast of the Falkland Islands to the United Nations next week.

headline.print_headline: Argentina Seeks Backing in Falklands Dispute

docs.snippet: As Argentina fights British plans to drill for oil around the islands, President Hugo Chávez of Venezuela ridicules British claims to the territory.

docs.snippet: The war of words continues between Britain and Argentina over Britain's oil exploitation off the coast of the contested Falkland Islands, France24 reports.

headline.main: Dispute Shows Argentina’s Lack of Oil Exploration

byline.contributor: Alexei Barrionuevo reported from Rio de Janeiro, and Charles Newbery from Buenos Aires.
byline.original: By ALEXEI BARRIONUEVO  and CHARLES NEWBERY

docs.snippet: A diplomatic dispute with Britain may be more about Argentina’s bitterness regarding companies’ wariness about working there.

headline.main: Quake Overshadows Clinton Tour of Region
headline.print_headline: Soured Over Policy, Leaders Await Sessions With Clinton

byline.contributor: Ginger Thompson reported from Washington, and Alexei Barrionuevo from Rio de Janeiro.
byline.original: By GINGER THOMPSON  and ALEXEI BARRIONUEVO

docs.snippet: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton had hoped to use the tour partly to address regional tensions.

headline.main: Clinton Urges Talks on the Falkland Islands
headline.print_headline: Clinton Urges Talks on the Falkland Islands

byline.contributor: David E. Sanger contributed reporting from Washington.

docs.snippet: At the start of a five-day tour of Latin America, the secretary of state pressed Argentina and Britain to work toward a resolution of their long-held claims for control of the islands.

headline.seo: Britain and France Sign Ambitious Military Cooperation Pacts
headline.main: British Military Expands Links to French Allies
headline.print_headline: Britain and France Expand Their Military Cooperation

byline.contributor: Alan Cowell and Scott Sayare contributed reporting from Paris.

docs.snippet: New deals envisage a force of 5,000 service members from each nation, with rotating commanders and land, sea and air components.
docs.lead_paragraph: New deals envisage a force of 5,000 service members from each nation, with rotating commanders and land, sea and air components.

headline.seo: British Commanders Say Defense Cuts Risk Falklands
headline.main: Officers Tie British Cuts and Risk to Falklands
headline.print_headline: Officers Tie British Cuts And Risk To Falklands

docs.snippet: The retired admirals attacked the decision to scrap Britain’s only aircraft carrier and its fleet of Harrier jump jets, saying it exposed the Falkland Islands to attack by Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: The retired admirals attacked the decision to scrap Britain’s only aircraft carrier and its fleet of Harrier jump jets, saying it exposed the Falkland Islands to attack by Argentina.

docs.abstract: Buenos Aires, once a bargain, is now simply a reasonably priced city with a well-deserved reputation as the Paris of South America - easy to walk, full of broad boulevards, plenty of made-in-France-and- assembled-in-Argentina architecture, old-fashioned corner cafes with comfortable wooden seats to while away the day.
docs.snippet: Buenos Aires, once a bargain, is now simply a reasonably priced city with a well-deserved reputation as the Paris of South America - easy to walk, full of broad boulevards, plenty of made-in-France-and- assembled-in-Argentina architecture,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Graciela, Ofelia and Pedro from Patagonia stood around the counter with me in Buenos Aires, chomping on pizza slices and trying to explain  why Argentines dine so late. It was 8 p.m. and they were snacking on their way home from work to tide them over before dinner. We were at Guerrin, an institution where you get to know the strangers standing next to you because you're in close quarters and there's nothing to do but talk. (My primary rule for lone travelers: always talk to strangers. At the very least you could end up with a bit of conversation over pizza. At best, you end up getting set up on a blind date. But more on that later.)

headline.seo: Brian Hanrahan, BBC Reporter, Dies at 61
headline.main: Brian Hanrahan, BBC Reporter, Dies at 61

docs.snippet: He delivered perhaps his most celebrated report from an aircraft carrier during Britain’s war to reclaim the Falklands in 1982.
